nodes.bodyText: yes... was not aware there is such an overload :D

In the past I have had pain using invokeExact (if the types aren't exactly right, normal covariance doesn't work, or something like that).
Consider using plain invoke.   I'm moderately confident the "exact" overload doesn't have any performance benefit.

Tomorrow I will give a better look (still recovering from a fever today), but I have experienced the opposite ie invokeExact to get a huge benefit in perf if compared with just invoke. I need to re-check, but that was my past experience with it.
Re the pain, I totally understand it, same experience here...
@carl-mastrangelo I tested this one and it works... I would prefer to use invokeExact if possible.
Similar comment, just use the vararg form?

Same for Adler32.
IIRC captured final are true finals 4 the JVM, so I would expect checksum.update(b); to be monomorphic, but to reduce the chance that the JVM won't be able to do that, this change would help...
I would prefer to keep it as it is as its cleaner imho and I am not convinced it matters.
Yep,. probably it won't worth doing it
